TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit LocalFileSettingsProvider extends System.Configuration.SettingsProvider implements class System.Configuration.IApplicationSettingsProvider
Public Class LocalFileSettingsProvider Inherits SettingsProvider Implements IApplicationSettingsProvider
type LocalFileSettingsProvider = class inherit SettingsProvider interface IApplicationSettingsProvider

summary.span: 为应用程序设置类提供持久性存储。

span.span: Provides persistence for application settings classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 设置提供程序定义用于存储应用程序设置体系结构中使用的配置数据的机制。Setting providers define a mechanism for storing configuration data used in the application settings architecture. [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] 包含单个默认设置提供程序（），该提供程序将配置数据存储到本地文件系统。The [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] contains a single default settings provider, , which stores configuration data to the local file system. 应用程序设置属性或一组属性通过使用 关联到特定的设置提供程序。An application settings property or group of properties are associated to a specific settings provider through the use of the . 通常，客户端程序不会显式访问此类;相反，当需要其服务时，应用程序设置体系结构会自动调用相应的设置提供程序。Typically, the client program does not explicitly access this class; rather, the application settings architecture automatically invokes the appropriate settings provider when its services are required. 例如， 的许多成员将其工作委托给关联的设置提供程序。For example, many of the members of delegate their work to the associated settings provider. 将设置保存到扩展名为 `.config`的配置文件中。 persists settings to configuration files that have the extension `.config`. 配置文件的内容结构化为 XML 文档。The contents of configuration files are structured as XML documents. 根据设置的作用域是应用程序级还是用户级，配置数据将分别存储为 `` 或 `` 部分组中的元素。Depending on whether the setting is scoped at either the application-level or user-level, the configuration data is stored as elements within an `` or a `` section group, respectively. 每个分区组分别由相应的 或 表示。Each of these section groups is represented by a corresponding or , respectively. 每个节对象由配置节处理程序拥有和管理，配置节处理程序是 类型的对象。Each section object is owned and administered by a configuration section handler, which is an object of type . 应用程序范围的设置和默认用户范围设置存储在名为 `application.exe.config`的文件中，该文件在与可执行文件相同的目录中创建。Application-scoped settings and the default user-scoped settings are stored in a file named `application.exe.config`, which is created in the same directory as the executable file. 应用程序配置设置为只读。Application configuration settings are read-only. 特定用户数据存储在名为 `user.config`的文件中，该文件存储在用户的主目录下。Specific user data is stored in a file named `user.config`, stored under the user's home directory. 如果启用了漫游配置文件，则可以存在两个版本的用户配置文件。If roaming profiles are enabled, two versions of the user configuration file could exist. 在这种情况下，漫游版本中的条目优先于本地用户配置文件中的重复项。In such a case, the entries in the roaming version take precedence over duplicated entries in the local user configuration file. 有关应用程序设置的详细信息，请参阅[Windows 窗体的应用程序设置](~/docs/framework/winforms/advanced/application-settings-for-windows-forms.md)。For more information about application settings, see [Application Settings for Windows Forms](~/docs/framework/winforms/advanced/application-settings-for-windows-forms.md).

related.span: 应用程序设置体系结构

span.span: Application Settings Architecture

remarks.format: ## Remarks 和 属性有助于消除不同应用程序中名称类似的设置属性的歧义。The and properties help to disambiguate similarly named setting properties in different applications.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在安装新版本的应用程序的过程中，当迁移应用程序设置时， 方法通常与 方法结合使用。The method is often used in conjunction with the method when migrating application settings during the installation of a new version of an application. 有关更多信息，请参见 方法。For more information, see the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法还管理 的特殊应用程序设置类型。The method also manages the special application settings type . 连接字符串存储在配置文件中由 ``元素分隔的特定部分。Connection strings are stored in a special section of the configuration file delimited by the element ``. > [!CAUTION] > 不使用加密来保留任何设置。 does not use encryption to persist any settings. 因此，请不要使用此提供程序存储纯文本密码或其他敏感信息，而无需采取其他防范措施，例如，在配置文件中单独加密信息。Therefore, do not store plain text passwords or other sensitive information using this provider without taking additional precautions, such as separately encrypting the information within the configuration file. 有关详细信息，请参阅[使用受保护的配置加密配置信息](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/aspnet/53tyfkaw(v=vs.100))。For more information, see [Encrypting Configuration Information Using Protected Configuration](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/aspnet/53tyfkaw(v=vs.100)).

span.span: A user-scoped setting was encountered but the current configuration only supports application-scoped settings.

summary.span: 将与指定的应用程序关联的所有应用程序设置属性重置为其默认值。

span.span: Resets all application settings properties associated with the specified application to their default values.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法还原指定应用程序设置组的存储值。The method restores the stored values of the specified application settings group. 的操作取决于应用程序设置属性的作用域：The action of depends on the scope of the application settings property: - 应用程序范围的设置不受影响。Application-scoped settings are not affected. - 用户范围的设置将重置为默认值，这些默认值在应用程序配置文件中以只读项的形式存储 `application.exe.config`。User-scoped settings are reset to the default values that are stored as read-only entries in the application configuration file, `application.exe.config`. 如果使用漫游配置文件，则漫游配置文件中的任何应用程序设置值都优先于在本地配置文件中找到的重复项。If roaming profiles are being used, any application settings values in the roaming profile take precedence over duplicates found in the local profile. 请注意，如果使用漫游配置文件，则可以有两个 `user.config` 文件，一个用于本地设置，另一个用于漫游配置文件。Notice that if roaming profiles are used, there can be two `user.config` files, one for the local settings and one for the roaming profile.

span.span: A user-scoped setting was encountered but the current configuration only supports application-scoped settings.

span.span: Sets the values of the specified group of property settings.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 设置包装类（派生自 ）包含 方法，该方法可用于保留其所有设置属性的值。A settings wrapper class, derived from , contains the method, which is called to persist the values of all of its settings properties. 此方法枚举与其设置属性关联的所有设置提供程序，并为每个 调用 方法，以执行实际的序列化操作。This method enumerates through all the settings providers associated with its settings properties, and calls the method for each to perform the actual serialization operation. 分别将每个用户范围的应用程序设置属性序列化为适当 `user.config` 配置文件中的相应应用程序设置。 individually serializes each user-scoped application settings property to its corresponding application setting in the appropriate `user.config` configuration file. 默认情况下， 方法使用以下逻辑序列来确定序列化方案，具体取决于设置属性的类型：By default, the method uses the following logical sequence to determine the serialization scheme, depending on type of the settings property: 1. 如果该类型具有与 方法实现关联的 ，则使用此转换。If the type has an associated with a method implementation, this conversion is used. 2. 使用 XML 序列化。XML serialization is used. 不过，你可以使用 指定首选的序列化机制。However, you can specify a preferred serialization mechanism by using the . 不支持 [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/includes/vsprvslong-md.md)]中的二进制序列化。 does not support binary serialization in [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/includes/vsprvslong-md.md)]. 如果用户作用域设置属性显式设置回其默认值，则本地文件设置提供程序将从用户配置文件中删除关联设置的条目。If a user-scoped settings property is set back to its default value explicitly, then the local file settings provider will remove the entry for the associated setting from the user configuration file. 此属性的下一次读取访问将只使用默认值。The next read access for this property will simply use the default value. > [!CAUTION] > 不使用加密来保留任何设置。 does not use encryption to persist any settings. 因此，请不要使用此提供程序存储纯文本密码或其他敏感信息，而无需采取其他防范措施，例如，在配置文件中单独加密信息。Therefore, do not store plain text passwords or other sensitive information using this provider without taking additional precautions, such as separately encrypting the information within the configuration file. 有关详细信息，请参阅[使用受保护的配置加密配置信息](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/aspnet/53tyfkaw(v=vs.100))。For more information, see [Encrypting Configuration Information Using Protected Configuration](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/aspnet/53tyfkaw(v=vs.100)).

summary.span: 尝试从相同应用程序的早期版本迁移以前的用户范围设置。

span.span: Attempts to migrate previous user-scoped settings from a previous version of the same application.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在单独的操作中迁移本地和漫游设置。 migrates the local and roaming settings in separate operations. 对于应用了 的每个应用程序设置，或从 派生的整个设置包装器类，会禁止 方法。The method is suppressed for every application setting that has the applied to it, or to the entire settings wrapper class, derived from . 这种方法的调用方式取决于正在升级的应用程序的类型：This way this method is called depends on the type of application that is being upgraded: - [!INCLUDE[ndptecclick](~/includes/ndptecclick-md.md)] 应用程序的每个版本都存储在其自身的独立安装目录中。Each version of a [!INCLUDE[ndptecclick](~/includes/ndptecclick-md.md)] application is stored in its own isolated installation directory. 安装了新版本的 [!INCLUDE[ndptecclick](~/includes/ndptecclick-md.md)] 应用程序并首次运行新版本后，内部逻辑将自动调用 将所有常见的应用程序设置迁移到新版本。After a new version of a [!INCLUDE[ndptecclick](~/includes/ndptecclick-md.md)] application is installed, and when the new version is first run, internal logic will automatically call to migrate all common application settings to the new version. 有关详细信息，请参阅 [ClickOnce 和应用程序设置](/visualstudio/deployment/clickonce-and-application-settings)。For more information, see [ClickOnce and Application Settings](/visualstudio/deployment/clickonce-and-application-settings). - 标准 Windows 窗体和控制台应用程序必须手动调用 ，因为没有常规的自动方式来确定何时首次运行此类应用程序。Standard Windows Forms and console applications must manually call , because there is not a general, automatic way to determine when such an application is first run. 实现此目的的两种常见方式是从安装程序中或使用应用程序本身，使用持久性属性，通常命名为类似 `IsFirstRun`。The two common ways to do this are either from the installation program or using from the application itself, using a persisted property, often named something like `IsFirstRun`. 请注意，对于更高版本，若要迁移应用程序设置，它还必须能够加载和读取旧版本的应用程序设置。Note that for the newer version to migrate application settings, it must be able to also load and read the older version of the application settings. 因此，它必须包含与新的和早期版本的应用程序兼容的包装类。Therefore, it must contain wrapper classes compatible with both the new and previous versions of the application.

span.span: A user-scoped setting was encountered but the current configuration only supports application-scoped settings.

span.span: The previous version of the configuration file could not be accessed.
